category: Herbs that Clear Heat and Purge Fire

action.primary: Clears Heat, resolves toxicity and dries Dampness

indications: Diarrhea, dysenteric disorders and vaginal discharge due to Damp-Heat

action.primary: Drains Liver Fire and benefits the eyes

indications: Liver Fire affecting the eyes with redness and swelling of the eyes, styes or superficial visual obstruction, leukoma

action.primary: Calms wheezing, stops coughs and resolves Phlegm

indications: Wheezing and coughs due to Lung Heat, bronchitis

contraindications: Use caution for those with Spleen and Stomach Deficiency Cold.
incompatibilities: Antagonizes Fr. Evodiae Rutaecarpae #{WuZhuYu} Wu Zhu Yu.

useCases: Hot dysenteric disorders due to Heat toxin searing the Stomach and Intestines.
Redness and swelling of the eyes, sties, or superficial visual obstruction.
Cools Heat toxin and dries Dampness to treat Hot type red and white dysenteric disorders.
Diarrhea or dysentery with tenesmus due to Damp-Heat.
Eye redness and swelling due to Liver Fire.

notes: It is used primarily in formulas for Damp-Heat affecting the Large Intestine and Gallbladder.
It is cold and drying to clear Damp-Heat, but also astringent to stop diarrhea.
It can treat Wind-Damp Heat Bi, superficial visual obstruction, lack of Jing in males, vaginal discharge in females and childhood convulsions.
It can be used as an eye wash.

Charred Fraxinus Qin Pi Tan is less cold and more easily enters the Blood to stop bleeding and alleviate dysenteric disorders. It is often used for passage of mucus, pus and Blood in the stool in dysenteric disorders. It can also be used for Intestinal Wind and irregular uterine bleeding.
